title: How to Take a Soil Test | From the Ground Up

tasks.task: Conducting a soil test for a garden
subtasks: Determine if garden needs a boost in spring
Gather necessary tools for soil testing (trowel, screwdriver, clean bucket, bag for sample)
Collect soil sample from garden at a depth of about six inches
Take ten samples from across the garden and mix them thoroughly
Provide a two-cup soil sample to the lab
Fill out a form provided by the lab for soil analysis and garden crop information
Consult local county Extension office for soil analysis lab recommendation and result interpretation

tasks.task: Conducting a soil test for a garden**
Perform a soil test for your garden
subtasks: Check if your garden could benefit from a soil test in spring
Collect the required tools (trowel, screwdriver, clean bucket, bag)
Collect a 6-inch deep sample from each of 10 different spots in the garden
Use the trowel and screwdriver to collect neat slices of soil
Mix all collected soil samples in the bucket
Transfer about two cups of mixed soil into the provided sample bag
Complete the lab submission form with necessary details
Contact your local county Extension office for assistance in choosing the right lab and interpreting results
